+/-'s overdone, overbearing Hritik, overused graphics, inspired even original parts not exciting.

-'s to much English including credits (more abusing), bad acting by the rest of the crew even Rekha looked straight out of a 70s film, ordinary songs especially in the second half.

Total 3.5/10 for me 10/10 for the public

I love Bollywood movie, especially Hrithik Roshan and finally, Bollywood gets around to making an excellent superhero movie and one that they didn't borrow the idea from (that i know of ). Hrithik Roshan does some excellent stunts ala Crouching Tiger and some excellent dance moves ala Hrithik Roshan. The plot is good and the evil bad guy is good. the plot had an unexpected twist that added to the movie. The girls, however, were definitely Bollywood "blondes"...they really didn't have to be that gorgeous and THAT stupid, did they? the first part of the movie really had some fun to it and was lighthearted and had wonderful scenery. the second part was also great, but didn't show enough of Singapore. this was all in all, a great sequel to Koi Mil Gaya.

review_title: some plagiarism, some copies, some coincidences, all in all a good show
review_detailed_main:
Part conceptualization from ET (as much as RR may deny) + part characterization from Forrest Gump (thats urban legend) + Emotional plot from Superman (surprisingly both have dollops of the same father-son bonding stuff, though, to RR's credit, this could not be a copy) + Costumes from Batman and Wonder woman (obv) + Technology plot from Paycheck and Minority Report (complete plagiarism, right down to look and feel) + Soundtrack from Gladiator (also complete but clever plagiarism) = Krrish.... All in all, a good show!!!

Something has to be a standard, and since Hollywood has consistently proved to be superior in almost all aspects of film making (as accepted by even Indian masters), this film has good story telling credentials, appropriate acting levels, pretty good sci-fi shots and reasonable entertainment value.

review_title: It was big at the time of its release
review_detailed_main: This movie was huge the year it released. I think it was the first Bollywood super hero movie. I remember I really did enjoy the film back then. Now as krish franchise continues it looks as if the film makers are targeting the younger audience more meaning the kids. Even though the box office numbers are great but the quality of the films is dropping. Well we will see what the new krish brings us in future.

review_title: A Brilliant Film & A Perfect Sequel!
review_detailed_main:
Krrish is the sequel to the 2003 Bollywood sci-fi film Koi Mil Gaya. If you didn't know that well now you do so go watch it to understand everything from this film, thou even without watching it you shouldn't be very lost to be honest.

Krrish like it's predecessor has an amazing cast with the addition of Priyanka Chopra as Krrish's love interest. Hritik Roshan once again does a superb job portraying both Rohit and Rohit's son Krrish. Priyanka does a similarly good job at her character Priya. Priya is nothing like Nisha as while being very beautiful(it's Priyanka Chopra/Mrs World after all) she is rather easily influenced by her friend Honey, to use Krrish's feelings for her in order to drag him to Singapore to act in their television series and save their careers at the same time. While that sounds horrible it does get better as Priya slowly starts to fall for Krrish, she eventually realizes this and tells Honey that she now has real legitimate feelings for Krrish. Unfortunately Krrish has already walked off after hearing the first bit of the conversation where they mention having used his feelings for her to rescue their jobs. Don't worry though as Priya ends up fixing up the mistakes she made and everything turns out good in the end. All in all each actor did a splendid job playing their respective characters!

Now for storyline, the storyline continues from where Koi Mil Gaya's ends but a couple years later (the in between time is covered at the start of the film by the narrator) after Nisha(Preity Zinta) has unfortunately passed away to due heartbreak at believing her husband Rohit lost. Rohit's mother Sonia Mehra(Rekha) is left raising Rohit's and Nisha's son Krrish. Unlike his father Krrish is born very smart and capable of incredible physical feats due to Jadoo's powers being passed down from Rohit to him. Sonia try's to hide him away from the world but it only works for so long... let me not say anymore before I spoil it but all in all a brilliantly continued storyline that will captivate the watcher and leave them wanting more. (A lot of reviewers have said there is not enough action/superhero scenes but remember this film is more a start of his superhero character/an origin story, plus a romance.)

Now onto the special effects, they were perfect for the film and fit the style of the movie as well as the characters without overdoing it and making the film just a bunch of flashy special effects one after another. The way Rajesh Roshan has done it is perfectly suited to the movie and film series.

Finally to the music and dance scenes, it wouldn't be a Bollywood film without these. But while many Bollywood movies have songs that aren't so great or scenes that add nothing to the film, Krrish's dance scenes are all amazingly choreographed and continue the telling of the story and the characters. The songs themselves are all really great and afterwards had me rewinding just to replay and listen to some of the songs again!

To wrap things off, this is a really well done film with an amazing cast, special effects, songs and dances and accomplishes everything it set out to accomplish.

A well earned 10/10 from me!

Introduction - Hritik and Rehkha once again. Living in some remote village away from public eyes. Hritik discovers his super powers and is soon leaping of horses and swinging of trees like some sort of modern day tarzan. He meets pryianka who is with a whole load of annoying college kids on some sort of camping trip and you are left with a boy meets girl inclusive of silly pranks type story. And its not until mosty of the film has passed that you get to see some serious action. Enter the villain of the story. and a whole Matrix style plot evolves. Pryanka's acting is average and annoying at times. Hritik is fairly OK and Rekha is the only one that really shines out. Nasserudin's villain is a bit too comical at times and could have been done better no where near the frightening mogambo of Mr India (played by the great Amrish Puri) All in all not bad but nothing to shout about average sequel.

review_title: why too less rating? this is fabulous
review_detailed_main: Why only 6.2 ratings? i think most user gave rating from 2006, as per history of bollywood, krish is best sci-fi or superhero movie , everything was pitch perfact , perfact story, action , screenplay, music . even in till today 2020 we would like to watch krish if its come on TV.

review_title: It is so bad that it's good
review_detailed_main:
I've not seen an Indian film since Mr. India when I was a child, this one certainly brought back some good memories.

I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed this average-Indian-length-but-ridiculously-long film. However, judging from filmmaker point of view, it is so bad that I even don't know where to begin.

Apart from wonderful music and bollywood-trademark-dance scenes, the film is made out of artistic-wannabe-but-surreal-dialogues, pieces-of-badly-executed-Hollywood-lookalike-actions, some shots were lit in a way that looks like it was superimposed, or maybe they were, plus over-the-top camera angle movements. Some parts were so corny that gave me goosebumps. Having said that, the lead actors have performed a wonderful job, as always.

The funny thing is, when you mix all those bad elements together and blend in the Indian way, it became great entertainment.

Will I watch it again? Absolutely not; will I watch another Indian film given the opportunity? Definitely!
KRRISH the excellent movie with magic in it's hinds.

The one advantage that a sequel has over any other film is that it needs no build-up to set the stage nor does it need to introduce the lead players; it can straightaway get into the meat of the story and catapult the viewer into the heart of the action. However, this one advantage has not been put to use by the makers of Krrish. Though a sequel to Koi Mil Gaya, it tries to begin a new on several fronts and the lame screenplay never really gets off the ground, except towards the last 15-20 minutes of the film, and by then it's too late.

What Koi Mil Gaya was to ET meets Close Encounters of the Third Kind, Krrish is to Superman meets Spiderman (with some Matrix action thrown in). But Koi Mil Gaya was an extremely well crafted entertainer with a crackerjack screenplay and deft direction by Rakesh Roshan, breaking the conventional hero mould and establishing that a great performance which is not necessarily heroic in true Indian tradition (but has heroism written all over in terms of originality and clever inspiration from other successful works) is bound to work. Krrish is not what one would expect from the same maker. It's not even a patch on the prequel, and wastes away valuable screen time establishing itself and its eponymous hero. Yes, this is a superhero film, and yes, some action sequences have a Matrix hangover and the special effects are worthy, well executed by any set world standard, but it's the writing which is very poor and lets the entire film down.

Krrish does not match up to the prequel nor does it live up to the huge hype which has been created.

Do you hate Bollywood films? If so, let me first say this: You're going to hate Krrish. That may sound like a no-duh-ism, but I think some of you may go thinking, " Well, this is really a super-hero movie with some songs in it.". Sorry. It's not quite like that. The music in Krrish is its very skeleton and if you just don't dig that kind of thing, the meat hanging off of it is just not going to be enough for you. Maybe you should just go see Superman Returns...but I thought it sucked, so don't come asking me for a refund. Besides, if Peter Parker started singing and dancing you'd hate Spiderman too...

Do you love Bollywood films? Then I think Krrish just might be your kind of movie. It has truly great songs by Rajesh Roshan; some of the best Bollywood songs ever. Amazing singing and dancing in creative musical sequences with fabulous cinematography and great sprinkles of special effects magic. Krrish is packed to the brim with all of the flowers, romance and warm fuzzy feelings that accompany the greatest Indian films. If you like Koi Mil Gaya you must see this. Its a great follow up and there's some amazing surprises and twists waiting for you...

Have you never seen a Bollywood film? or have you seen Bollywood films and were not so sure about them? Go see this movie. You've never seen a Bollywood film? WIth all this talk of flowers and dancing would you be surprised if I told you Krrish is a super-hero movie with a very serious tone and some shockingly dark twists? It is. The juxtaposition of the sweet video-like song sequences with the frenetic wire-fu leaping and bum-kicking of the action sequences is really quite entertaining. You've seen Bollywood films but were not too sure how to feel about them? Krrish is wonderfully Indian, but more accessible to western audiences than some Bollywood films. While it is 3 1/2 hours long it moves at a brisk pace. The music and action sequences are perfectly placed within the film to create a whooshing flow. The fight scenes are really brilliant and considering Superman Returns had zero fight scenes Krrish is the place you will want to go for some bone jarring, villain juggling, super powered fists of fury this summer!

review_title: Not good as KMG and Krrish 3
review_detailed_main:
The movie is not upto the mark.Its nowhere be near to KMG and Krrish 3.CGI level and fight scenes are very less than the other two movies in the franchise.I had a huge expectation from this movie but it didn't live up to it.Songs are good though.

Overall if you have watched KMH and Krrish 3 and liked it then Krrish will surely will disappoint you.Thumbs down.

A runaway hit in India, where its homegrown title superhero "Krrish" will likely out-gross the much-touted "Superman Returns" import, Rakesh Roshan's sequel to his madly successful sci-fi extravaganza "Koi ... mil gaya" pilfers "ideas" from multiple Hollywood comicbook sagas with beaming insouciance. Not content to walk on water, swing through forests at supersonic speed, and demolish a cricket field with a single ball, Krishna (reigning heartthrob Hrithik Roshan) also sings and dances divinely as romance decidedly trumps deeds of derring-do for most of the pic's 172 minutes. Enjoyable, daffily improbable escapist romp further expands Bollywood's pop genre repertoire.

Fearing the discovery and exploitation of her very "special" young grandson Krishna, Sonia (Rekha) whisks the boy off to the hinterlands. There, the plump little geek develops into a gorgeous hunk who communes with animals and smiles contentedly at all creation. When a beautiful career woman named Priya (Priyanka Chopra) drops, Jane-like, into his life via a parachute, Krishna disappears into the trees to play childish tricks on her and her friends, occasioning numerous duets as the couple frolics through the jungle.

But Priya works for a media company, and, when her job is threatened, she lures Krishna to Singapore, ostensibly to meet her mother but in reality to peddle her newfound "superboy" discovery. Before he goes, however, Sonia tells Krishna that his father was betrayed by an evil scientist, triggering flashbacks to "Koi ... mil gaya" and to Krishna's dad, who looks exactly like him (not too surprisingly, since Hrithik played his progenitor in the previous film).

Krishna promises his grandmother that he'll hide his extraordinary lights under a bushel. Not until more than half-way through the film does Krishna's alter-ego, Krrish, finally materialize, his zigzag half-mask and shiny black coat disguising him even less effectively than Clark Kent's dorky homburg and glasses. After a big musical number, a three-ring Bombay circus showstopper, Krrish appears on cue to save children trapped in a burning tent -- performing a death-defying rescue that may be the only thing that could top the just-wrapped song.

Thesping is engaging, aside from Miss World 2000 Chopra's vapid posing (though, to be fair, it is hard to maintain any tonal continuity while changing costumes more frequently than one changes expressions). Rekha brings depth to her role as the nurturing grandmother, and Naseeruddin Shah, as the power-mad corporate scientist Dr. Arya, has great fun chewing up the futuristic scenery.

review_title: Do we really need an Indian superhero?
Krrish flying head to head with Superman

review_detailed_main:
Okay, this one was promoted as first major hindi superhero film. But it turned out to be a usual Bollywood romantic comedy.

The film has no major plot in the first one hour. Krrishna lives in lonely hills with his dadi. He falls in love with a tourist girl, Priya. After some 40 minutes of time waste, she goes back to her place(Singapore). She calls him and asks him to come there. After a heated argument, he convinces her. We are told of his past then. The story starts only in the second half. Still there's just a bit of plotline, almost non existent.

Stunts were wierd. Not saying they were bad, but unusual. The superpowers of Krishna will put Hollywood superheroes to shame. Whatever he touches turns powerful, that's the only way you can explain how the volleyball he hit cracked a rock.

Hritik is a good actor. He was 32 when he did Krrish but he brilliantly captured the innocence of a 20 year old boy. But he whispers a lot. Rekha and Naseeruddin Shah supported brilliantly. Priyanka chopra is diassapointing and Manini Mishra overacted. Hemant pandey is good in his brief role. But everyone is monotonous throughout the film. Also, except Krishna, no character is given any depth.

There isn't anything in it which we haven't seen a hundred times before. Why would I advice someone to watch it?

I Cant Believe at what some people are saying about this film, that it was crap. Its suppose to be a Fictional movie, who cares about the Technology stuff. I can name you 100 Hollywood HIT Films like this, anyway.

review_title: Bollywood's first superhero makes a storming entrance!
review_detailed_main: Who better than Hrithik Roshan to attain the honor of giving India it's first superhero? It clearly shows that Hrithik put in his 200% into this film whether it be his death-defying stunts across the skyscrapers of Singapore, his superb acting, or his superhero physique. You'd think the Roshans couldn't come up with a better storyline than the original, but think again! Krrish has just as intense and moving a story as Koi Mil Gaya. Apart from the breathtaking action, the story has strong emotions and themes making it all the more enjoyable. Where Hollywood superhero movies like Batman, Spiderman, and Superman have villains with an odd, powerful physical strength, Krrish's villain has a power of a different dimension--time. Powerful emotions and an intelligently written script set Krrish apart from your typical Hollywood superhero flick. Priyanka was extremely disappointing and irritating for the first time. Songs are lame.

review_title: Brilliant - the movie Krrish the acting of Hrithik and his stunts
review_detailed_main: Hrithik Roshan is the best superstar in the industry not only in Bolywood but also in Hollywood and he has proved it through Krrish. He is always underestimated by many people but he is more talented than khans of Bollywood and if he does not get Oscars for this movie, it will be ignorance of talent by the world. Watch the movie his actions, his emotions and his acting and dancing skills all Superb even Hollywood Superman can't match his standards. ANd another great thing is some actions he has performed himself and not through computer generated images, only due to him the movie is a super hit blockbuster in India and abroad.

I am a long-time Superman fan, not South Asian, and loved this movie. It is good both within Bollywood standards as well as on its own in terms of introducing a new concept in Indian cinema. I agree with Effulgent-Warrior's comment's 100% -- to compare it to other genres of movies would be a mistake. In and of itself, it combines a good story, excellent cinematography, solid visual effects, wonderful music and an incredible performance by Hrithik Roshan.

I went into this movie with absolutely no idea of who Hrithik Roshan was or any knowledge of the movie's background (other than that it was about an Indian superhero), and was blown away. The standards are incredibly high across the board, it's a great plot, the performances are solid, and it's a very entertaining experience overall. To dissect it against American standards would be a big mistake. If there's one thing that bothered me it was the blatant product placement, but I know that's a Bollywood standard as much as the music and almost 3 hour length!

Hrithik Roshan could easily have a distinguished career in the U.S., able to go up against any American or British action actor in my opinion. He's that good.

In summary, this is a first-rate film that deserves to be watched. I can't wait for Krrish 2.

I saw this movie today and well I am darn happy with it. Whoever said about there being no comic books in India does'nt realise mo one was going out to make a comic book movie but all that the makers were trying to do was to dish out something different for Indian audiences who are sick of all those stupid lovey-dovey movies.

Yes,there are a lot of clichés here.Yes there are many scenes in which it is evident that the makers turned towards Hollywood for "Inspiration" but so what .They made a damn good movie .

The acting was really good .Mostly the movie focused on Hrithik but the rest of the cast especially Naseer also showed there class .The story had a number of plot holes which I am not going to disclose but you simply had to accept them.But the songs were when it was difficult to watch the movie.

All in all a really good movie.

review_title: Krrish is ambitious and it delivers!
review_detailed_main:
I must have read about 10 reviews so far in three days and I do not understand the reason for the gloom. I went to watch Krrish after reading a scathing review and I was so surprised! The problem lies in the expectations. Why would you go for Krrish expecting to see Hollywood style special effects? And more pertinent a question is why should you compare? Granted that we in India get to watch movies like M:I:3 and X-Men 3 as soon as they release in the West, must not we realize that taking to such movies and making such movies is a whole lot different? And in comparison, Krrish has more emotional reach than either of the above sequels managed. So I think its a good balance. Hollywood uses its studio power to spend millions on special effects, Indian films don't have that kind of money - exactly the reason why they attempt to tug at your emotions...

Yes I loved Krrish.

Its the story of the son of Rohit Mehra, the mentally challenged kid in Koi Mil Gaya, who receives powers from an alien called Jadoo. When the movie opens, Rohit and his wife are dead and their Krishna is a precocious five year old. He is too mature and intelligent for his age. Afraid what to make of this, his grandmother (Rekha) takes him far away to Manali and home schools him. Krishna is friendless. In the absence of human friends, he grows up with nature and has a rapport with its beings.

Enter Priya. Its a case of love at first sight. After a few songs later, he follows her to Singapore where she is a reporter. There circumstances force him to reveal his powers. And consequently he gets embroiled with the bad scientist with the dream of ruling the world, Dr Arya.

Krrish's romance is cute and innocent and the love angle is fresh. The action sequences, though they take a little time appearing on screen, when they appear they are mighty good, for a first attempt at this genre of movie-making. Hrithik Roshan showcases his intensity and screen presence. Even in aggressive moves, he is elegant. He is a fine actor. A pity that he shines only when his father directs him.

Priyanka Chopra doesn't quite seem perfect for the role of Priya. Priya was a role that required someone who looked a bit more natural and wilder. Chopra looks a sophisticate without any rebelliousness in her. Someone like Parveen Babi or Zeenat Aman would have chewed up this role. Rekha as the grandmother doesn't have much to do this time, other than look concerned and sad.

The background music is good in bursts...there is no consistency. A really good background score would have been an asset. The music is quite old style.

You must watch this movie without any background clutter of Spidey movies, Batmobile, M:I series and other SFX movies. Be fair, for the west had access to this technology decades before us, even the Chinese are far ahead. Let our film makers come to terms with this (its a toy for them now) only then will they be hungry to get the best of it.

When you watch Krrish, you deeply feel the passion, effort and honesty the father-son team invested in the film. Over two years in the making, Krrish is indeed the fruit of labor that manages to reap the sweetness and some true spellbinding moments for its viewers too. The movie is finely structured so that there is no conflict with its prequel 'Koi Mil Gaya' and runs with a fine pace, barring the songs that are a big dampener compared to earlier two Hrithik films, including the mega one 'Kaho Na Pyar Hai'. The director Rakesh Roshan should be applauded for not getting carried away with fatherly love, lest it jeopardize other crucial characters that push the story forward. Priyanka Chopra has a meaty role of almost a parallel length with the superboy. Rekha had her screen moments too. Naseeruddin Shah as the bad man has a good entry point and animating short & crisp monologues of a notorious newsreader. Preity Zinta is surely missed but her exclusion was perhaps essential for the sequel and likewise for the friendly alien 'Jadu'. Once again, the screenplay is skillfully penned by a brigade of writers including Rakesh Roshan and Honey Irani to name a few. Hrithik- Priyanka introduction scene is one of the most stirring love-scenes in the present Hindi cinema, rendered with innocence and 'love is in the air' magical moments. The comedy in the first half is not brash but rather the one with connectivity at the grass roots with the flavor of modernism. The stunts are awe-inspiring and antithesis to pre-release film speculations of a hybrid between a Superman and Spiderman. The expected flights are replaced by giant grasshopper leaps over skyscrapers and the clichéd cape is also dropped for a reversible black long cloak; not very impressive, but effective. The cinematography is top notch capturing Kullu Manali and Singapore in exciting and adventurous frames as the playground for our superhero, who is also the man of the moment; Hrithik Roshan. The overnight superstar of 'Kaho Na Pyar Hai' has once again warranted his stardom amongst the equals a.k.a. the Khans. A sane head over strong shoulders, jutting almost superhuman jumbo biceps, the man of steel has put tantamount pains in his character portrayal projected with realism and conviction. Why watch Krrish? In a nutshell, Hrithik Roshan! But to give devil his due, watch Krrish because it boasts of great acting, tight screenplay, seductive cinematography, enthralling stunts, effective story telling, bull's-eye direction and because you loved 'Koi Mil Gaya' and Hindi Cinema is ready for sequels! Phir Hera Pheri, Darna Zaroori Haimany more to follow

review_title: Don't consider Krrish as a remake of Spiderman with Indian Masala mixed
review_detailed_main: Krrish is not an ordinary Indian movie which has action sequences that remind you of Spiderman, batman, and other movies of Hollywood. It differs itself from them. Krrish will be enjoyed by kids and family audiences because of no vulgar scenes. Though Hollywood is just mimicking most of the scripts from Hollywood, the existence of Indian culture hasn't completely vanished away. This is why most NRI and other Asian audiences tend to like a movie like this. As a matter of fact, the stunts of Hritik might influence the children as most children did after watching "shaktimaan". The hard work of Rakesh Roshan is seen by the strong character such as Krishna (hritik) and Dr. Siddhant Arya (Naseeruddin Shah). These two characters are like a spirit of this movie. The rest character is well on their places.

Anyone can understand this movie, people of any age can view along with their families too. It has given a tough beating to Superman, which is struggling in India. This shows that Indians can make world class movies with SFX and that too 1/10th of the total cost, which is required in Hollywood to make a movie.People should watch it.

review_title: Bollywood's foray into super-human films in a grand style
review_detailed_main: A film in which the director's hard work and dedication can be clearly seen.Hrithik's performance is outstanding.Priyanka Chopra is beautiful and managed to perform her role well.Songs are OK. This is a sequel to Rakesh Roshan's Koi Mil Gaya... This movie shows us what happens to Rohit (Hrithik in Koi Mil Gaya) after the alien Jadoo leaves bestowing powers to him. The young Hrithik(Krishna) is grown in a remote village due to Rekha's fear of losing grandson due to his gifted strengths and power which passed on from his father, Rekha's son. Priyanka entrance. After a little romance/drama he visits Singapore to bring the heroine back to India. He vows to his grandma that he will not use his powers and get recognized. But circumstances compel him to do so and Krishna becomes Krrish. Rest is all about the super-human stunts and high-tech computer labs and eventually an expected finish with the death of the bad guy. This is an awesome movie for Hrithik fans and kids. Bollywood has made a strong entry into super-human films. This film will not let anyone down except for music lovers who like simply watching songs. Songs do not appeal the first time but couple of the numbers are actually good. Kudos to the Roshans for making Krrish. People who have seen Superman, Spiderman, Pay check, Minority report will have a deja vu feeling but at the same time it is wrong of us to expect a complete original film in an era where a new film is released every day.

Krrish is the first attempt by an Indian director to make an Sci - fi movie and he has done an excellent job. Let me tell you its not easy to make a movie. Those people who criticize Krrish to be a mix of superman,batman and what not are just criticizing the movie for the SAKE of it. I would recommend those people to make a movie first and then understand how difficult it is..... All directors cannot be steven spielbergs and I think Rakesh Roshan has done a good job . And this is just his first attempt........give Bollywood time and the day is not far when they would make even better movies than Hollywood. Hrithik was just awesome and he is in my books the best dancer in bollywood right now. Eagerly waiting for the next sequel too......

I think one more success in the hat of Priyanka Chopra. She had added a feather to her beauty. She is gorgeous. Being my favorite actress, She is just lovable in each and every sequence in the film. I wish I could some day meet Priyanka. OK on to the film, Hrithik has acted geniusly, I feel that it is one of the biggest success for him as a super action hero. He has implemented life in the role he was given. He was also Brilliant. So as Rajesh Roshan He was also best. His direction was perfect and to the task. It is quite difficult to make a movie in which a child aged 6 years to a man aged 60 years can sit together and view it. Just Perfect and Fabulous. And above all I really Love Priyanka whole heartedly. She is cute Lovely and just..............Lovely. Priyanka looks so beautiful in all the sequences in the film.

review_title: A treat for Indian comics fans..we have one worthy superhero!!
review_detailed_main:
I dreaded going for Krrish not because i don't like the theme but that it may not live up to my expectations.I was astounded by the technical aspects and the details of character Rakesh Roshan gave his son.Any superhero enthusiast will know that all the ingredients in this movies are mandatory for any superhero.Mind you the director did not have a base to build up on for a superhero except his prequel.Its as different from Koi Mil Gaya as Rohit is from Krrish.Introduction scenes are pleasant.It starts off mellowly and keeps changing gears every 15-20 min.Hrithik is the heart and soul of the movie.No other hero in Bollywood or Hollywood can emulate his emotions or his inimitable style.The sequences are reminiscent of Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon style movies.The scene where the hero heroine descend after the rescue is beautiful.The movie moves predictably as the target audience is such.

Moving on to more important stuff.As you would have noticed in trailers the superpowers are given special care to.Rakesh Roshan has made sure that Krrish is no Superman or Batman or Spiderman.He does not fly or use ropes or webs to move from one place to another.He just jumps and bicycles in AIR!!This sole aspect is unnoticed by the many detractors but only hardcore comic fans will notice =>.For a 40 day martial workshop the performance of Hrithik is outstanding by any measure.As usual he is not satisfied by giving his 110% he always gives 200% for any performance.He succeeds too.

He gets smitten by the reporter-on-vacation as its his first contact with outsiders.He follows her to Singapore and eventually the movie has many twists and turns(which are predictable for seasoned movie goers)but decent enough as passable.The twist in last 20min is laudable as no one would have seen it coming.The ending was very satisfactory.

The movie has some cons too.Some scenes were too comic book like and could have been avoided a.k.a. some kicks,punches and a few multiple attacks within same second could have been avoided.It is a bit long at nearly 180 minutes.Songs are average but a treat to watch as Hrithik delivers effortless dance sequences.

The best technical and action effort to ever to grace an Indian screen.Kudos to Rakesh-Hrithik pair.They click together well and they have now been time tested.This genre was an untouched territory but now we have a worthy team to take India into this.Here's wishing them a blockbuster on their hands and hoping desperately to see many more sequels of Krrish.

The use of sci-fi is first time introduced in Indian cinema and I will be very happy if they continue to produce a good movie like this. This is the best movie of the year. And I am really dying to watch the next sequel of this movie. Its a 10/10.

review_title: Krrish - a landmark film in Indian Cinema
review_detailed_main: Krrish is an outstanding film. It is a landmark film in Indian Cinema. The film deserves to be a bigger hit than what it appears to have been. This is as per my perception. Within a few weeks of release, promos drastically reduced. It seems Rakesh Roshan has been more than happy with the success. And probably a bit complacent as well. The film is superb in its genre, particularly in the context of Bollywood which is having its first Super Hero film. Hrithik is unbelievable, story does not have loose ends and Naseer adds class to the film. The film is fun, engaging and stunts fit well in the story. Good work by Rakesh & Hrithik.

review_title: An Awesome movie! But, not better than Koi Mil Gaya.
review_detailed_main: This movie was very well done and the songs and dances were amazing! Hrithik Roshan is such a loose dancer! So Flexible. But Priyanka Chopra disappointed me. Her role was just like every other superhero's lover role, helpless and and over acter, and overreactor. She shouldn't have been in the role. I don't blame her for the acting she did. It's the script writers that need to be blamed. She doesn't deserve to be blamed at all. But she could have made suggestions and not stood back. The best role was played by Nasserudin Shah for his villainous role as the power crazy, time maniac. He really scared me when he did his "breaking news" quotes. He just seemed so calm yet violent. He acted like Nana Patekar. He just scared the heck out of me, but at the same time, he would just stay calm and just say, " That's true if he's gone, how will I ever control time?" He is just about the scariest villain I've seen, next to Amrish Puri. All in all, the movie was good, but, sadly, not better than the prequel.
I think it's a great movie. At a time when almost all the film makers were going on the same track, Mr. Roshan chose to do something different.

review_title: A marvelous watch for the family
review_detailed_main:
Directed and produced by Rakesh Roshan, Krrish 2006 is an Indian Hindi-language superhero film. Starring Hrithik Roshan and Priyanka Chopra, Naseeruddin Shah, Rekha, Manini Mishra, Archana Puran Singh and Sharat Saxena, this movie portrayed the best storytelling of a superhero. A second installment of Koi mil Gaya, is a complete package of action, thrill and mystery. The charming chemistry of Hrithik and Priyanka is not disappointing. It is an enigmatic and fascinating story of Krrish who was forced to use his superpowers to save the world.

The originality of the story has absorbing elements of insightful sensitivity and thought provoking idea of good over evil. This film has the potential to imagine and think out-of-the-box. The big budget movie is an excellent and intriguing plot which has the powerful ability to leave an indelible mark on the watchers. Before watching movie, take a look at the synopsis to make a fair decision.

Below is the synopsis.

Synopsis:

Krishna (Hrithik Roshan) was endowed by his father with magical abilities at birth. Priya enters his life and takes on a life of her own. He goes to Singapore when she calls his name. The megalomaniacal scientist Dr. Siddhant Arya is about to alter the course of history forever in Singapore. Dr. Arya is the only person standing between him and his dangerous fantasies.

Songs:

The music composer Rajesh Roshan has given the future generation an all-time chartbuster hit song. From Dil Na Diya to Pyaar ki Kahaani, all the songs are timeless priceless gifts for everyone to sing and dance.

The melodious voices of Shreya Ghoshal, Sonu Nigam, Udit Narayan, Alka Yagnik and Rafaqat Ali will force you to add all the songs in your along playlist. The calming and emotional lyrics of the songs can refresh your moods.

Acting performance

The acting of all the actors and actresses are flawless and commendable. With good dialogue delivery and catchy dialogues, the fast moving and engaging acting of all the performers had given the best all time superhit. A sensible acting will make you go through the emotions such as, sympathy, anger, joy and fascinating romance.

You will not get disappointed, bored or feel stupid.

Krrish is neither as bad as some people claim through simple and generic nitpicks nor as good as some people hype it up. But the movie is good enough to be enjoyable throughout its entire running length. Krrish is a very light hearted movie that one can see with his family and not take too seriously. The story is easily predictable. They might have ripped off too many Hollywood movies and may have also flooded the scenes with different sponsor brand names but despite all those flaws, there is a lot of enjoyable content. Hrithik Roshan's acting is never to be doubted, especially after Lakshya (this movie is no lakshya though) and he does deliver a superb performance. Just don't go expecting something ground breaking because it is not, even though it may be a landmark by Bollywood standards.

review_title: Not a Movie, But an Emotion <3
review_detailed_main:
When I was a kid, I don't remember, how many times I'd watched this movie.

If I watch it now, I'll find it a good movie or a very good movie, but the emotions are still way too attached.

Its background score, the action scenes, the story, everything is just almost perfect. Yes, it has a lot of silly mistakes, but that doesn't take away the fact that it's one of the best superhero movies ever made.

Even its sequel couldn't touch its legacy, I don't think any other Indian movie will.

I absolutely love this movie and it deserves all the success it has got, especially in the time of its release!

review_title: a beautiful experience to see Indian superhero
review_detailed_main: Hrithik Roshan is one of the best things ever happened to bollywood and without him Krrish would not be possible. And who says music is not that great, songs are so melodious and again the picturization was too good. One can easily watch this movie mulitple times just to see Hrithik and his super hero style. Some of the stunts like jumping over the river,monkeying between the trees fighting with Chinese mafia were awesome. Rekha's makeup was over board to make her look older. which was unnecessary. Amazingly, Priyanka Chopra manages to look okay with Hrithik. Other actors and Naserudin were good. In the first part there is a old filmi style comedy, which some how appeals. There is a comedy, emotions, love, values and an awesome and clean entertainment for the whole family.

My All time favourite Movie. This film was made at a time when Bollywood had no proper superhero film like Hollywood. Only shaktimaan and few others were there but they dominated the TV shows but a proper film, no, not that time.

Many people in 2006 (due to lack of proper internet) werent aware that Krrish was the sequel to Koi Mil gaya. Only after watching the film they realized that.

Krrish was an instant hit not only because it was a sequel to an already superhit film, but the fact that Indian audience got to witness probably its first proper looking superhero film on the big screen. The plot was also believable considering it inherits from its prequel hence krishna's powers were quite well justified.

I saw Krrish the other day...and i was really surprised to see how intelligently the film has been made..it has everything for a perfect movie.. i am a big movie buff and have seen almost all super-hero movies,,,be it superman, spiderman batman,,, and compared to them i think the storyline of krrish is much more realistic and believable,, it is a new beginning for Hindi cinema..as now it is almost at par with Hollywood.. this 10 million dollar has turned out to be better and more entertaining than 200 million dollar superman,,,what a movie it was...though it would have been a little more better if hritik spent more time in the mask...way to go rakesh sir..we're waiting for the rd part..with a little better graphics,,

Now this was money well spent, Every money has been counted for.

I just sat for 3 hours in a cold outdoor cinema at the Pusan International Film Festival, South Korea and can frankly say that Krrish has to be one of the most surreal, most wonderful movie experiences I have had the pleasure to be subjected to for a long time! I haven't laughed so much in my life, and I don't mean that in a negative way. Myself, my friends and the several hundred Koreans there, were in absolute hysterics from beginning to end. I am sure that it wasn't the directors intention to make us laugh, but laugh we did and I thank him for it.

The Korean audience were applauding the fight sequences and at the end of the movie, there was a huge cheer and round of genuine applause for a really entertaining night.

Great stuff...go and see it.

i rented this movie after seeing the trailer and thinking "aaah, bollywood has discovered hong Kong style rope-work" and wondering what they would have done with it. hrithik has never struck me as a heavyweight in the acting world (although he's gorgeous and he is one of--if not the--best male dancer in bollywood) but in koi mil gaya and krrish i was really proud of the work he did. very different from the normal type of character he plays, and subtle, too. (i'm trying not to spoil the story here).

overall, i'd say the last 45 minutes or so was the best part of the movie, when it got more into what he had to do and away from the lovey dovey stuff which, considering the characters they wrote for those girls, was extremely disappointing and given the heightened intelligence Krishna is supposed to be endowed with, almost unbelievable.

i'm glad i saw it and came away with a new respect for hrithik as an actor..

i do think the cover shots for the DVD and the movie menu might have been partly inspired by takeshi kaneshiro in "Returner"...anyone else know what i'm talking about?!

review_title: About Krrish and Why I was pleasantly surprised
review_detailed_main:
I've been watching Hindi movies every since I was 17 years old, and I have to say, never have I seen a movie like this one! I mean, I love Rhitik Roshan but there is something about the way he Plays Krrishna Mehra that was just filled with genuine acting! It was amazing and if you are a person that watch the movie just for graphics, then this movie exceeds expectation. The fight scenes are well prepared, the singing were in context and not just a bunch of people singing and dancing around trees for now reason.

I love the blend of cultures in this movie and I love the way Krrish was a superhero but at the same time, he is human. He is NOTHING like Superman or any of the English superhero that I grew up with. Krrish is more of the people's hero.

Again this movie was a great watch and I think after sending this, I really should watch it again.

Cheers all! K
